description.narrative: 5.3. By 2021, National, sub-national and community-level education stakeholders have strengthened capacity to increase access to education, especially to secondary education, for adolescent girls and marginalized children in targeted provinces.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 5.3. By 2021, National, sub-national and community-level education stakeholders have strengthened capacity to increase access to education, especially to secondary education, for adolescent girls and marginalized children in targeted provinces.

description.narrative: Education COVID-19 response and recovery plan developed to address continuity of learning for out of school children (OOSC) aligned with the OOSC education strategy. UNICEF has supported adaptation of eight-week radio programme in three core subjects for transmission through Zambia National Broadcasting Corporation (ZNBC) and community radios. UNICEF has also supported development of teachers' manual for accelerated learning to enhance alternative access to education. Career and skills club facilitators guide has been finalized to support the scale up of career and skills development. Moreover, nationwide assessment has been undertaken to assess schools' readiness for re-opening and implementation of remote learning. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:30/06/2020

System Strengthening - Innovations - Innovations to improve access and learning for the most disadvantaged children are implemented at scale and are sustainable - score (1-4), see guidance
Level of development of national strategies to address inequalities in access, participation and retention [score]
